verses.roman:
dadhi, dugdha, nanī, takra, rasālā, śikhariṇī
sa-lavaṇa mudgāṅkura, ādā khāni khāni

synonyms: dadhi—yogurt; dugdha—milk; nanī—butter; takra—buttermilk; rasālā—fruit juice; śikhariṇī—a preparation made of fried yogurt and sugar candy; sa-lavaṇa—salty; mudga-aṅkura—mung dhal sprouts; ādā—ginger; khāni khāni—cut into pieces.
translation: There was yogurt, milk, butter, buttermilk, fruit juice, a preparation made of fried yogurt and sugar candy, and salty mung dhal sprouts with shredded ginger.
